instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with <CAPACITOR>C7514</CAPACITOR> exploded, no liquid damage. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> was shorted. Removed <CAPACITOR>C7514</CAPACITOR>, short is now gone but <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> only 0.450V

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Do you get Magsafe light?
Post <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> exact voltage.

Be aware at <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR>/03 as common failure on this board...
